etymology.description: 门(門) (mén, "gate") around 关 (guān, "to close") = gate closure mechanism -> passage control
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 關 (guān, "to close") originally incorporates the component 门(門) (mén, "gate") to indicate its relation to controlling a gate or passage, signifying a mechanism through which something is opened or closed. This connection to gates is consistent with the meaning of regulating or securing an area.
etymology.simplification: To create the simplified form 关, the component 门(門) (mén, "gate") was entirely removed, focusing on the essential closing function represented by 关.

examples.chinese: 他关掉手机(他關掉手機)，开始专心工作(開始專心工作)。
examples.pinyin: Tā guān diào shǒujī, kāishǐ zhuānxīn gōngzuò.
examples.english: He turns off his phone and begins to focus on his work.

examples.chinese: 他把心门关得很紧(他把心門關得很緊)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ xīn mén guān de hěn jǐn.
examples.english: He keeps his heart closed tightly.
